people.note: Yours truly.
Youngest ever Fields medal winner. Inaugural winner of the Abel prize.
Declined the Fields medal.
First female Fields medalist.
Solved Fermat's Last Theorem.
First female Abel Prize winner.
Inventor of Calculus
Inventor of Calculus
Father of modern algebraic geometry.
Made foundational contributions to geometry in physics, representation theory, number theory, and the foundations of mathematics.
Made foundational contributions to computer science, quantum mechanics, functional analysis, game theory, nuclear warfare strategy, foundations of mathematics, and many more subjects.
Revolutionised the foundations of mathematics.
Made foundational contributions to quantum physics. Invented spinors.
Made foundational contributions to quantum physics.
Made foundational contributions to quantum physics.
Inventor of special and general relativity.
Made foundational contributions to quantum field theory.
Invented the Higgs boson.
Father of computer science.
Inventor of tensor calculus.
Inventor of algebraic topology and made foundational contributions to analysis.
Made foundational contributions to abstract algebra, Euclidean geometry, the foundations of mathematics, and proposed Hilbert's 21 problems.
Pioneer of women in mathematics. First person to define the notion of a commutative ring. Made foundational contributions to the study of symmetry in mechanics.
His Erlangen program revolutionised geometry and placed Non-Euclidean and Euclidean geometry on the same footing.
Inventor of Riemannian geometry. Made foundational contributions to analytic number theory and analysis.
Made vast and foundational contributions to number theory, analysis, differential geometry, and physics.
Made foundational contributions to real and complex analysis.
Made foundational contributions to analysis, especially the notion of infinite series.
Made foundational contributions to algebraic geometry.
Made foundational contributions to analysis, differential equations, and physics.
First complete proof of the impossibility of solving the general quintic equation.
Made foundational contributions to analytic number theory, analysis, and differential equations.
Inventor of Hamiltonian mechanics and quarternions.
Inventor of linear algebra.
Discovered group theory.
First mathematician to define the concept of an abstract group.
Published the first proof that e is transcendental.
Wrote down the laws of classical electromagnetism.
Defined real numbers through the Dedekind cut, and invented the concept of an ideal in ring theory.
Made foundational contributions to the theory of continuous symmetries of differential equations.
Discovered the notion of infinite sets.
Discovered and solved the heat equation.
Made foundational contributions to the formalization of arithmetic.
Made foundational contributions to probability theory.
Father of modern differential geometry.
Founder of the Bourbaki group. Made foundational contributions to algebraic geometry.
Invented measure theory and defined the notion of the Lebesgue integral.
First defined the notion of a differentiable manifold.
Founded mathematical intuitionism.
Made foundational contributions to topology and metric spaces.
Made vast contributions to number theory.
Founded the theory of functional analysis.
Made vast contributions to logic, the foundations of mathematics, and philosophy.
Made foundational contributions to differential geometry.
Famously prolific and founded the field of discrete mathematics.
Made foundational contributions to cosmology and the theory of black holes.
Made foundational contributions to cosmology and the theory of black holes.
Made significant contributions to finite group theory, and popularised recreational mathematics.
Made vast contributions to mathematical logic.
Made foundational contributions to the theory of fluid mechanics, and distilled Bernoulli's principle.
Made vast and foundational contributions to a wide range of mathematics and physics, especially geometry, calculus, number theory, and mechanics.
Invented the notion of tangent spaces at age 14.
Initiated the study of the wave equation.
Made foundational contributions to analysis, number theory, and physics. Inventor of Lagrangian mechanics and the calculus of variations.
Formalised the theory of probability and made foundational contributiosn to analysis.
Made major contributions to number theory and unique factorization domains. Was a pioneer of women in mathematics.
Introduced rigor to analysis, and gave a fully rigorous ε–δ definition of a mathematical limit.
Discovered non-Euclidean geometry.
Discovered that planets travel around the sun in elliptical orbits and defined the three fundamental laws of planetary motion.
Founder of projective geometry.
Made significant contributions to philosophy.
Made significant contributions to economics.
Made significant contributions to economics.
Made foundational contributions to calculus, analytic geometry, and number theory.
Made contributions to projective geometry and probability theory.
Made foundational contributions to optics and mechanics.
First mathematician to use the term "integral."
Discoverer of l'Hôpital's rule. Made many foundational contributions to infinitesimal calculus subsequently published in l'Hôpital's first textbook on calculus.
Discovered that the Earth revolves around the sun.
Father of modern scientific method
Inventor of the Cartesian coordinate system. Made foundational contributions to philosophy.
